item.title: Nearly two out of every three firms in the Asia Pacific region will provide outplacement services even when it is not mandated by law
item.description:
Since the announcement of the large merger, rumors have been circulating. It’s clear that your department can’t absorb everyone from the other company, leading colleagues to compete for the boss’s attention, even though their own position is uncertain. Finally, HR schedules the meeting everyone has been anticipating. US-based HR consultant Nick Corcodilos, in a November 2013 edition of his “Ask the Headhunter” e-newsletter, states that outplacement is often offered as a consolation prize after termination...
